content.question: Which of the following statements best explains why using an experimental research design is inappropriate in studying human development?

choices.label: Experiments cannot establish cause-and-effect relationships over time.
Direct, long-term manipulation of a child’s environment during an experiment is unethical.
Experiments with young children are always unethical.
Identifying which genetic traits are interacting with the environment is impossible using an experiment.

content.answer: Direct, long-term manipulation of a child’s environment during an experiment is unethical.

topic.text: 3.1: Themes and Methods in Developmental Psychology

skill.text: 2.D: Evaluate whether a psychological research scenario followed appropriate ethical procedures.
